comments:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Select two plugins in Package Explorer
2. Execute "Open Manifest" command

I executed this command by Ctrl+3 and then typing there Open Manifest. Is there more convenient way to call this cmd? Preferably shortcut.



eclipse.buildId=I20070625-1500
java.version=1.6.0_02
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_US
Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86 -clean

Created an attachment (id=78834)
check if proj is not null first

fix is simple :)

i've also looked for other uses of WorkspaceModelManager.isPluginProject(IProject) and they all seem to be null safe

Hi Jacek,

Thanks for reporting the problem and attaching a patch.  The patch works well, but I made a small improvement to enhance it.

We were getting the NPE because the selection was a JavaProject.  Since we only checked for IFiles and IProjects, a JavaProject caused problems.  In addition to adding the check for null, it would be nice if we could open up the Manifest Editors for the selected java projects.  Since JavaProject implements IAdaptable, we can use that interface to get the corresponding IProject.  This not only prevent the NPE but also work as the user would expect.

Since you contributed to the fix of the bug, you are not eligible to be included in the highly prestigious (in our eyes) wall of PDE contributors: http://www.eclipse.org/pde/pde-ui/committers/committers.php  If you would like, please send me a head shot with a leafy background :)
Fix applied to HEAD.  Will be available in 3.4M3

(In reply to comment #2)
